DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to compare the effectiveness of lanreotide autogel to placebo after a single injection. Effectiveness and safety were then also assessed following four fixed-dose injections and after one year of treatment given at titrated doses.
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety Study of Varying Doses of Lanreotide Autogel in Patients With Acromegaly
DOC.criteria: documentation of a diagnosis of active acromegaly based on either of the following definitions: 1. the patient has never received somatostatin analog nor dopaminergic agonist or had previously received this medication but had stopped more than 3 months before visit 1 and had a mean growth hormone (GH)level >5ng/mL at visit 1; or 2. the patient was receiving treatment with a somatostatin analog (other than lanreotide autogel) or a dopaminergic agonist at visit 1, had a mean GH >3ng/mL at visit 2 (or visit 2a) and had at least a 100% increase in mean GH levels between visit 1 and visit 2 (or visit 2a) receipt of radiotherapy for acromegaly within 3 years pituitary surgery within 3 months prior to visit 1 prior receipt of lanreotide autogel or GH antagonist anticipated need for pituitary surgery (adenomectomy) or radiotherapy during the study period known hypersensitivity to any of the test materials or related compounds clinically significant renal or hepatic abnormalities
